content: reversible mug mat by annmarie aquino size    4 inches by 4 inches materials   30-40 yards of fingering weight yarn    us 1 or us 2 2 25mm or 2 75mm knitting needles    tapestry needle gauge   40 sts/84 row = 4 inches on us 1    32 sts/60 row = 4 inches on us 2 notes this mug mat or coaster is knit in linen stitch a slip_stitch pattern that creates a fabric that lies flat and is attractive on both the front and back smaller needles will yield a much denser fabric that looks very much like woven fabric the larger size needles will make for more relaxed knitting and a looser gauge but the resulting fabric will still be dense enough i recommend using a us 2 for medium-weight sock yarn as knitting the pattern with this weight on a us 1 may not make for very comfortable knitting gauge is not particularly important unless you are knitting a set of coasters in which case i recommend using the same weight yarn and same needles for the set you may use any cast on and bind off methods you prefer however whichever methods you use i recommend casting on and binding off just a bit more tightly than you usually do for socks or other garments this will create tidy edges to the mat all slipped stitches are slipped purlwise except for the first slipped stitch of row 2 which is slipped knitwise © 2010 annmarie aquino page 2     reversible mug mat by annmarie aquino abbreviations  ws - wrong side    wyib - with yarn in back  rs - right side    kw - knitwise  wyif - with yarn in front   st/sts - stitch/stitches  k - knit     p - purl linen stitch pattern / multiple of 2 stitches row 1 ws slip 1 wyif *p1 slip 1 wyib repeat from * to last st end p1 row 2 rs slip 1 kw wyib *k1 slip 1 wyif repeat from * to last st end k1 mug mat pattern cast on 40 sts if using us 1 needles or 36 sts if using us 2 needles work row 1 and 2 of the linen stitch pattern for a total of 84 row if working 40 sts on us 1 needles or 60 row if working 32 sts on us 2 needles or until the mat measures four inches in length work one row in plain knit bind off in knit wet the mat thoroughly and lay it flat to dry patting it into shape to measure 4 inches by 4 inches square use tapestry needle to weave in yarn ends although this is a very simple and straightforward pattern please respect the time taken to work it out and test it feel free to make copies of this
